com.siperian.bdd.userexits.operations

Interface IOpenOperationPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IBaseOperationPlugin

    public interface IOpenOperationPlugin
extends IBaseOperationPlugin

    Defines the user exits for a case when Primary Object gets opened in Data View.

    Should have OPEN_OPERATION operationType

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AfterOpenOperationResult afterOpen(BDDObject object)
      Gets called after a user has opened an object in the Data View tab.
      OperationResult beforeOpen(CustomizableBDDObject object)
      Gets called before a data view tab is opened.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.siperian.bdd.userexits.operations.IBaseOperationPlugin

        getOperationContext, getOperationType

    • Method Detail

      • afterOpen

        AfterOpenOperationResult afterOpen(BDDObject object)

        Gets called after a user has opened an object in the Data View tab. Note, this method operates with read-only data passed via BDDObject and thus at this point it is impossible to change sate of Primary Object and/or its children.

        The call is made as for primary object as for evey child and grandchild within SA. This method is consistent with lazy-load paradigm what means that it gets executed only for child objects that are visible on the UI. Note, that an application developer can still access children and grand children via BDDObject.getChildren method but in this case it will be impossible to determine, which of the traversed children are currently visible on UI.

        An application developer can provide notifications to be shown on the Primary Object's tab and/or child tabs via return class AfterOpenOperationResult. If notifications are not needed then the following predefined class instance can be used AfterOpenOperationResult.EMPTY.

        Parameters:
        object - primary object bound to DataView screen
        Returns:
        result of operation execution.
        See Also:
        AfterOpenOperationResult, AfterOpenOperationResult.NotificationsHolder

      • beforeOpen

        OperationResult beforeOpen(CustomizableBDDObject object)

        Gets called before a data view tab is opened.

        The call is made as for primary object as for evey child and grandchild within SA. This method is consistent with lazy-load paradigm what means that it gets executed only for child objects that are visible on the UI. Note, that an application developer can still access children and grand children via BDDObject.getChildren method but in this case it will be impossible to determine, which of the traversed children are currently visible on UI.

        An application developer can change the following properties for the object that gets passed into this method:

        • make any field of a given object be non-editable via CustomizableBDDObject.setReadOnly(String)}
        • update any field of a given object via BDDObject.setValue(String, Object)

        If logic implemented in this operation was successfully executed, the operation should return a reference to OperationResult.OK.

        Parameters:
        object - primary object bound to DataView screen
        Returns:
        result of operation execution.
        See Also:
        CustomizableBDDObject, OperationResult
